titles.title: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to permit an extension for filing drawback claims in cases where the President has declared a major disaster.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1974)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

bill.summary: 9/28/1994--Introduced. Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to authorize the Customs Service to extend for up to 18 months the time a claimant may file a claim for a drawback (refund) on imported merchandise in cases where the President has declared a major disaster.
